body.p:
Youngs Point. La,
March 1st 63.
His Excellency
James F Robinson
Sir
Inclosed I send you the Recomendations of several officers, which I trust you will commission.
Many officers are resigning, from the different Regts, without regard to any particular state.

There are probably one or two officers yet in my Regt, who may try to resign, because they have not been recomended for promotion, should they do so, I have no doubt, the General, Comdg will accept, their resignations and let them return to civil life.
I have not had a case of small pox in my Regt, for several days. I have some hope that it will now, stop.
The River continues to rise, and has risen over the former height, some six inches, though it is rising quite slowly, at this time,

Head quarters 3rd Regt Ky vols
Youngs Point La March 1st 1863
To His Excellency Govenor Robinson
I would respectfully make the following recommendations.

✓ William H. Jackson to be 1st Lieut and Qr masters of the 3rd Ky V. I. vice W. W. Watkins resigned. To rank from the 1st January 1863 promoted from qr Ms Sergeant.
✓ 1st Lieut Thos H. Wilson to be captain of Co D 3d Ky vice A. H. Clark resigned 2nd Lt Hamilton Flanery to be 1st Lt Co D. 3rd Regt Ky V.I. vice Wlson promoted. Orderly Sergeant Henry J. Clark to be 2nd Lt Co D 3d Ky vice Flanery promoted. All To rank from this date.
✓1st Lieut Peter Hinkle to be captain Co J. 3rd Ky vice W. A. Dozier resigned. Gale S. Davis to be 1st Lt same co vice Hinkle promoted. from former recomendation
✓Orderly Sergeant Joseph Frisbee to be 2nd Lt same co vice Davis promoted all lo rank from this date

I am Govoner
Very Respectfully
Your Obt Servant
T. T. Garrard
Col, 3d Ky Regtmt
